concept.title: Learning and Training Specialization Usage
concept.shortdesc: The DITA 1.3 learning and training support includes new domains that deprecate the DITA 1.2 interactions, but provide a path for backward compatibility.

conbody.p: The key changes in the DITA 1.3 support are:

ul.li: Support block elements in question content, answer content, and feedback.
Make the @id attribute for interactions optional.

section.title: New implementations
section.p: If you are implementating learning and training support in DITA for the first time, use the DITA 1.3 support, use the learning2Domain in document types that need assessments, as demonstrated by the learningAssessment-learning2.dtd.

section.title: Existing implementations to continue DITA 1.2 assessment support
section.p: If you have already implemented learning and training support with DITA 1.2 and none of the limitations adversely affected your support, then you can continue to use the learningDomain in document types that need assessments, as demonstrated by the learningAssessement.dtd and learningAssessment-learning2.dtd document type shells.Is this true? WEK: Yes, this is true as I've corrected it.
